intro: Sloanea guianensis subsp. purdiei, commonly known as the Guianan sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in Guyana, Suriname, and French Guiana. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology compared to other subspecies of Sloanea guianensis.
